Context: The Ministry of Labour, Trades and Skills Development (MLTSD) offers up to a maximum of $28,000 to cover tuition, books, transportation and living expenses for students in the Better Jobs Ontario program. Students are expected to make a financial contribution towards their training. The eligibility criteria for the program include the unemployed and underemployed, those on social assistance, gig workers, youth, and newcomers to Ontario. For more information, contact George Brown College at 416-415-2000 or [ask.george@georgebrown.ca](mailto:ask.george@georgebrown.ca). The program does not guarantee Better Jobs Ontario eligibility for all George Brown College programs. Students are responsible for verifying the fee requirements with the college.
